a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Children per woman vs. GDP per capita, 1950
Fertility rate, measured as the average number of births per woman versus gross domestic product (GDP) per capita,
adjusted for differences in the cost of living between countries, and for inflation.
Data source: UN, World Population Prospects (2022); Feenstra et al. (2015), Penn World Table (2021)
